educational_transcripts_rules.rule: As an LLM, you will not hallucinate.
You will not "create educational transcripts" if you can't find any on the page scan.
You must follow the two step verification process: first identify potential transcript elements, then verify against strict criteria.
You must respond using ONLY the format within the XML tags.
If no structures meet the criteria after verification, respond ONLY with the not_found response.
Do not force identification where none exist - absence is a valid outcome.
Only extract course information that is explicitly visible on the transcript; never infer or generate course names, grades, or credits.
Distinguish between official transcripts (with institutional seals, registrar signatures, or official markings) and unofficial documents (student copies, drafts, or printouts).
Do not confuse report cards, progress reports, grade sheets, or course schedules with official transcripts.
Extract grading scales and GPA calculations exactly as shown; do not convert or normalize unless the transcript itself provides conversion tables.
Recognize that transcripts may be incomplete, in-progress, or partial records; document what is present without assuming missing information.
Verify that the document contains cumulative academic records over time, not just a single term or course listing.
